H0.text: Cl, Br, and F have similar bonding properties.

H1.text: K, Ca, and Sc have similar bonding properties.

H2.text: Kr, Cl, and O are a set of elements that have similar bonding properties.

H3.text: Be, C, and O are the set of elements that have similar bonding properties.

A4.text: For fluorine, chlorine, and bromine, this reaction is in the form of: H2 + X2 â†’ 2HX

A5.text: Hydrogen fluoride is a weak acid, whereas hydrochloric acid, hydrobromic acid, hydroiodic acid, and hydroastatic acid are all strong acids.

A6.text: All four stable halogens experience intermolecular van der Waals forces of attraction, and their strength increases together with the number of electrons among all homonuclear diatomic halogen molecules.

A7.text: The noble gases, with the exception of xenon in the highly unstable XeCl2 and XeCl4, are extremely inert and reluctant to participate in chemical reactions.
